intro: Vittadinia dissecta var. hirta, commonly known as the hairy vittadinia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. Its flowers are usually yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. Vittadinia dissecta var. hirta is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
